metadata.title: CVE-2019-5188 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A code execution vulnerability exists in the directory rehashingfunctionality of E2fsprogs e2fsck 1.45.4. A specially crafted ext4directory can cause an out-of-bounds write on the stack, resulting in codeexecution. An attacker can corrupt a partition to trigger thisvulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

e2fsck-static - 1.42.9-3ubuntu1.3+esm2
e2fslibs - 1.42.9-3ubuntu1.3+esm2
e2fsprogs - 1.42.9-3ubuntu1.3+esm2
libcomerr2 - 1.42.9-3ubuntu1.3+esm2
libss2 - 1.42.9-3ubuntu1.3+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: e2fsprogs package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.42.9-3ubuntu1.3+esm2').
